channel.title: Sem on Jayden Nord
channel.description: Recent content in Sem on Jayden Nord

item.title: Measurement error in SEM
item.description: Suppose we wanted to fit the following model below using health data from Hoffman and Fidell (1979). The observed variables are age - age bracket of the participant scstress - stress measure rescaled to help SEM estimation esteem - self-esteem measurement attmar - satisfaction with marital status control - locus of control measurement The diagram can be expressed formulaically: $$ \begin{align*} \text{age} & = \lambda_1 \text{(age_f)} + e_1 \\ \text{scstress} & = \lambda_2 \text{(stresss_f)} + e_2 \\ \text{esteem} & = \lambda_3 \text{(self)} + e_3 \\ \text{attmar} & = \lambda_4 \text{(self)} + e_4 \\ \text{control} & = \lambda_5 \text{(self)} + e_5 \end{align*} $$ The observed measures are linear combinations of latent factors and residuals, which are sometimes interpreted as measurement error.
